content.text: Solve the inequality \(4x - 9 > 4x(5 - x)\)
There are 11 prime numbers between 10 and 50
18 is not a multiple of 5
All multiples of 10 are multiples of 5

It is given that \(\mathbb{C}\) is the set of integers, \(P\) is the set of prime numbers between 10 and 50, \(F\) is the set of multiples of 5, and \(T\) is the set of multiples of 10. Write the following statements using set notation
In the Venn diagram below shade the region that represents \((A' \cap B) \cup (A \cap B')\)
In the Venn diagram below shade the region that represents \(Q \cap (R \cup S')\)
On the grid below draw, for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 360^{\circ}\), the graphs of \(\quad y = 3 \sin 2x\) and \(\quad y = 2 + \cos 2x\)
State the number of values of \(x\) for which \(\,3\sin 2x = 2 + \cos x\,\) in the interval \(0^{\circ}\leqslant x\leqslant 360^{\circ}.\)
Find the value of \(a\) and of \(b\) for which \(\mathrm{f}(x) = a - (x + b)^{2}\) and hence write down the coordinate of the stationary point of the curve \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\)
On the axes below, sketch the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\), showing the coordinates of the point where your graph intersects the \(y\)-axis
It is given that \(\mathrm{f}(x) = 4 + 8x - x^{2}\)
Calculate ABC
Calculate \(\mathbf{A}^{-1}\mathbf{B}\)

It is given that \(\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 4 & -2 \\ 8 & -3 \end{pmatrix}\) , \(\mathbf{B} = \begin{pmatrix} 2 & 0 & 4 \\ 5 & -1 & 4 \end{pmatrix}\) and \(\mathbf{C} = \begin{pmatrix} 5 \\ -2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix}\)

The normal to the curve \(y = x^{3} + 6x^{2} - 34x + 44\) at the point \(P\) (2, 8) cuts the \(x\)-axis at \(A\) \(y\)-axis at \(B\). Show that the mid-point of the line \(AB\) lies on the line \(4y = x + 9\)
Find the value of \(p\) such that \(\binom{-5}{p} \mathrm{kmh}^{-1}\) represents the velocity of the ship
Write down, in terms of \(t\), the position vector of the ship, relative to \(O\), \(t\) hours after 12:00
Find the time when the ship is due north of \(O\)
Find the distance of the ship from \(O\) at this time

In this question \(\begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 0 \end{pmatrix}\) is a unit vector due east and \(\begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}\) is a unit vector due north. At 1200 a coastguard, at point \(O\), observes a ship with position vector \(\begin{pmatrix} 16 \\ 12 \end{pmatrix}\) km relative to \(O\). The ship is moving at a steady speed of \(10\mathrm{kmh}^{- 1}\) on a bearing of \(330^{\circ}\)
Given that the perimeter of the shaded region is \(20\mathrm{cm}\), express \(y\) in terms of \(x\)
Given that the area of the shaded region is \(16\mathrm{cm}^2\), express \(y^2\) in terms of \(x^2\)
Find the value of \(x\) and of \(y\)

In the diagram \(PQ\) and \(RS\) are arcs of concentric circles with centre \(O\) and angle \(POQ = 1\) radian. The radius of the larger circle is \(x \text{cm}\) and the radius of the smaller circle is \(y \text{cm}\)
Find the number of different ways the paintings can be displayed if there are no restrictions
Find the number of different ways the paintings can be displayed if the paintings by each of the artists are kept together
An art gallery displays 10 paintings in a row. Of these paintings, 5 are by Picasso, 4 Monet and 1 by Turner
Calculate the number of different committees which can be selected
One of the 6 senior students is a cousin of one of the 5 junior students
Calculate the number of different committees which can be selected if at most one these cousins is included
A committee of 4 senior students and 2 junior students is to be selected from a group of 6 senior students and 5 junior students
The remainder when the expression \(x^{3} + 9x^{2} + bx + c\) is divided by \(x - 2\) is the remainder when the expression is divided by \(x - 1\). Show that \(c = 24\)

Given that \(x + 8\) is a factor of \(\begin{array}{r}{x^{3} + 9x^{2} + bx + 24} \end{array}\) , show that the equation \(\begin{array}{r}{x^{3} + 9x^{2} + bx + 24 = 0} \end{array}\) has only one real root
Find the distance travelled in the twelfth second
Find the value of \(t\) when the particle is at instantaneous rest
Find the acceleration of the particle when \(t = 9\)
A particle travels in a straight line so that, \(t\) s after passing through a fixed point \(O\), its displacement, \(s\) m, from \(O\) is given by \(s = t^2 - 10t + 10\ln (1 + t)\), where \(t > 0\)
Find the velocity of the particle as it passes through \(O\)
Find the distance travelled by the particle in the third second
Find an expression for the acceleration of the particle and hence find the stationary value of the velocity
A particle travels in a straight line so that, \(t\) s after passing through a fixed point \(O\), its velocity, \(v \mathrm{cm} \mathrm{s}^{- 1}\), is given by \(v = 4 \mathrm{e}^{2t} - 24t\)
Answer only one of the following alternatives
